intro: Lippia disepala, commonly known as the two-stamen lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lippia disepala is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
